scheme_name: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for the Wards of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles
description: The “Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme (PMSS) for the Wards of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles” is a scholarship scheme which was introduced by the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India from the academic year 2006-07 to encourage higher technical & professional education for the dependent wards & widows of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles (CAPFs & AR) Personnel.
benefits: Up to 5 years duration (depending on course duration)
eligibility: Wards/widows of deceased CAPFs & AR personnel who died in harness/election duty, wards of personnel disabled due to causes attributable to Government service, and Wards of Ex CAPFs & AR personnel in receipt of Gallantry Awards.
Wards/widows of retired and serving CAPFs & AR Personnel. (Personnel below Officer Rank)
Pursuing first professional degree programme in Engineering, Medicine, Dental, Veterinary, BBA, BCA, B. Pharma, B.SC (Nursing, Agriculture, etc.), MBA and MCA, etc.
Minimum of 60% marks in 10+2/Diploma/Graduation or equivalent (new applicants).
Minimum of 50% marks in each subsequent academic year (renewal applicants).
documents: Certificate issued by the educational institution (renewal)
